text: Cybersecurity company KnowBe4 Inc, backed by private-equity firm KKR & Co and funds affiliated with Goldman Sachs, said on Monday it was aiming for a valuation of up to $3 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.Clearwater, Florida-headquartered KnowBe4 was founded in 2010 by serial entrepreneur and cybersecurity expert Stu Sjouwerma. The company had 37,000 customers as of the end of last year, according to its filing. KnowBe4s platform allows clients to simulate phising attacks on their employees and check how well they are safeguarded against such attacks. It also offers security awareness training.The company joins technology firms rushing to public markets in a particularly busy year, which has seen the likes of gaming platform Roblox Corp, e-commerce company Coupang Inc and cloud-computing firm DigitalOcean go public. KnowBe4 said it would sell around 11.8 million shares along with a group of selling stockholders, priced between $16 and $18 each.At the top end of this range, KnowBe4 would raise about $213 million.Shares would be listed on the Nasdaq under the symbol KNBE, the company said in its filing.Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, BofA Securities and KKR are the lead underwriters for the offering.
